English: In the morning
Montignac
Enjoying the view?
Very much actually. Montignac is a beautiful city after all - and now we are here to finally restore order.\nAnd it took us only two days since landing.
Certainly better than the last time.

True. Let us not beat around the bush any longer. I don't wish to insult your intelligence, Lemontov.\nYou must have long figured out the first attack was just a small nudge, testing the waters, so to speak. To see if the NATO would take the bait.
I did suspect as much.
Of course you did. I did not think for a second our plan would get past you. Although it did get past all those idiots in Kremlin.
You speak very openly.
We are very far from the central government, Lemontov. We are more free than others. Free to pursue ou rown goals.

You might not be fully aware that after Livanokh the Kolguyev garrison was reduced to only a token force.\nThe peace treaty required it. It was done to make sure we never threaten local stability again.
What changed?

The American intervention on Everon, of course. Their military buildup and expansion had to be answered - we received more men.\nNot enough to mount a serious attack, but enough to create new opportunities.

A good plan  - my own I might add. But even when the enemy marched on Kolguyev, the Kremlin lost balls.\nI had to make sure our situation weas truly hopeless for them to finally budge and grant us the resources we required.
The attack in central Kolguyev... all this time, your incompetence was just a play?
I thought you would see through it. It brings me joy to know I managed to deceive the great Grigory Lemontov.
A great feat indeed. Tell me then what do you need this army for?
You are aware, of course, that Everon is not our final goal. This story does not end here. It is Malden and it has always been Malden.
But what is there I am not at liberty to disclose to you at this moment. But follow us and you shall find out for yourself.
Now, I laid my cards on the table so that you are aware of the situation and who you are dealing with. Come in, we need to discuss the next phase.
I'm going to go straigth to the point. The rebels came to us and requested our help. Apparently, a lot of their men were captured and taken prisoner - including their second in command.
We found where they are held. Your task is to join forces with the rebels and help them reclaim those prisoners.
Sounds easy enough.
That's not all. Once you rescue them, kill them.
What?

They are like rats. You get rid of them and they always come back. They are relentless, they fight for their beliefs no matter the opposition.\nThey are dangereous and must be dealt with. We are not making any mistakes this time.
Either we deal with them now or they are going to cause us problems in the long run. Executing their highest command should do the trick.
This is... this is low, Zubarev.
Low? This is how you operate, Lemontov. What's the deal? This should be just another mission for you.
We made a deal with them. They are our allies. Betraying them like that...
There is no betrayal, we never signed anything. And allies? Please. Temporary co-belligerent is more likely. They will turn on us the moment the NATO is gone.
Stil, I find it underhanded... unbecoming...
Is this even Lemontov speaking? My, my, I knew the prison softened you.
I am far from soft, Zubarev. I find it deplorable, that's all. This is not the way things should be handled.
You might find it surprising, but I do agree with you. This order is straight from comrade Volkov though and it's not up for discussion.
Are we clear on this, Lemontov? You know, I am long looking for an excuse to put a bullet in your head. Will you give me one?
Hm? Is dying as a traitor to your liking? What's it going to be?
I'll do it, of course. I am loyal, Zubarev, never doubt it.
I never did. I just wonder who to. A meeting with the rebels, tomorrow morning here. Don't be late. Dismissed!
This is terrible... Absolutely terrible...
What am I supposed to do?
Grigory! Hey, Grigory!
Sergei! What happened to you to end up in the hospital?
Le Moule happened. Tough fight. We almost had to retreat but an ace pilot saved our asses. What about you?
Me? Yeah, I'm alright. Listen, can we talk more privately? Let's go over there for a second.
Sure, lead the way.
I thought we should not talk discreetly in public.
Sergei, listen, something terrible is about to happen. The rebels need our help rescuing their comrades from prison.\nWe are to provide assistance tomorrow.
That's terrible how?
We are to... execute them right after.
Wh...What?
I know, I know. Volkov's orders. Or maybe Zubarev's. I don't even know anymore. It's fucked up beyond belief.
Well, you're not going to do it, are you?
What am I supposed to do, Sergei? It's a direct order. If I don't do it, they find someone else and I'm going to the tribunal.\nOr better yet, straight in front of the firing squad!
Grigory, you cannot do this!
I must do it! Do you not see?!

They are our allies! They've been helping us, they are ready to put down their arms once we are done here! They desire peace! And you're going to slaughter them like animals? In the middle of a rescue operation at that?!
What other choice do I have, Sergei?
You can choose not to do it!
Then it's my head on the chopping block! How does that solve anything!?
What about making our move? What about we march in and shoot down Zubarev, Volkov and all the others? Take matters into our own hands.
That's crazy, Sergei. Volkov isn't even here! The army will see us as mutineers and traitors. We would be lucky to even get close to Zubarev.\nNo, the time to strike is not yet here.

It's always waiting with you, Grigory! We are still waiting, still biding our time, still expecting some new information to shed a light on the fact we are completele fucked. When is it going to be the time to act?!
We would die pointless deaths if we are not ready. It will not be on Everon, Sergei.
So you're waiting for Malden then. Expecting the grand reveal of their goal to solve everything? And you're willing to let the rebels die for it?
This is not what I would have wanted, but if that's what it takes - yes.
I cannot believe this. I fought with them, Grigory. They saved my life!
I've never been this disappointed in anyone. I thought you were better, Grigory. If you must do it, so be it. But don't come anywhere near me ever again.
Sergei! Sergei?!
Your car is ready, comrade major.
I slept terribly.
Did I even sleep? The whole night feels like a fever dream to me.
What am I even doing? What am I going to do?
Executing the rebels.. I feel sick. Sergei's pissed, understandably. What can we do against orders though?
Is this truly Volkov's order? Or does it come from Zubarev?
He played me like a fiddle. Of course he is not a bumbling idiot, I am the idiot!
I underestimated him badly. How could it happen? I normally see right through people. My perception is in the shitter.
This must not happen again. I must keep both my eyes open!
But of what this? One thing is to kill in war, another is to stab in the back. Like some underhanded rogue. The worst kind of a two-faced shakal.
I feel worse than shit. And the day has barely started.
Is there a way to save them? Hardly, I'm going to be watched by my own team. Probably Kaplinsky has strict orders - if I let them go, I'm going to get a bullet in the back of my head.
This is so shit! I feel so powerless. A murder of a war crime level is about to happen and I am to be the main perpetrator. And I can't do anything about it.
I must stop Volkov and Zubarev from reaching their goal on Malden. Do I have to become war criminal to do that?\nThis is probably their game to test my loyalties.
Fuck this shit. I am Grigory Lemontov, after all. I did not come this far to fail. Fuck you, Zubarev, two can play that game.
Comrade major, we've been waiting for you. Our squad is ready. This is Gaston AStier and his people. They understand English.
They also understand French, Kaplinsky.
Hm, should not have been expecting anything less from the famous Lemontov. After that castle, I'm looking forward to working with you.
Likewise. Let's get to it. What do we have?
A small mechanized squad is preparing to attack Entre Deux. We can go with them to get closer to our target.
The prisoners are kept at a coastal base in the east. There are two roads leading there.
We should avoid the southern front and large bases, otherwise it shouldn't be an issue. We are ready to go if you are.
Rescue Prisoners
Meet with the Rebels
Soviet Attack
Take the Soviet Spetsnaz as your squad
Take the French rebels as your squad
Retreat to the forests
Retreat to the boats
